activities.loc: Branch 3 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:39 PM 
Defendant Richard L Brown appears via zoom audio.  Attorney Krysta Parson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record. 

The Court appoints counsel at no cost since Mr. Brown qualifies for public defender services. 
recess: 2:44pm 

NEXT: (1)Appoint Counsel (2)Status on 12/12/22 at 9:30am via zoom
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:08 AM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Prosecuting attorney Krysta Parson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard L Brown in court. 
Court reviews case history, status and filings. 
Defendant indicates that he qualifies for a SPD but they have been unable to appoint counsel for him. 
Court clarifies that an SPD Statement regarding appointment was filed this morning. 
Court will continue this case for STC by ZOOM on 10/3/22 at 2:30pm. 
Recess 10:11am

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
STC (of counsel) by ZOOM on 10/3/22 at 2:30pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

--not acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no presence in the City of Lake Mills, Wisconsin
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

[ae] case called 09:01 AM Defendant Richard L Brown in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--not acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no presence in the City of Lake Mills, Wisconsin
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)

recess 9:08 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 7/29/22 at 9:00 am
